section.p:
Cross off the 150 Shards.
The advocate tells you that there is only one certain way of avoiding a conviction by the arbiters - by not appearing in court at all!

'There are two way this may be achieved,' he says. 'The first is to choose trial by bokh. Even foreigners may elect this revered, and time-honoured method. Bokh is an ancient and holy game, and you will have to play against one of the court-appointed master of bokh. I advise this course only if you are well versed in the intricacies of the game. The second is to pay a large inducement to the arbiters. Four hundred Shards will guarantee a favourable outcome.'
